Reviews.Title: “Dubai Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: skfamily_15
Reviews.Content: A decent place to live in Dubai and a good sized double room, this is in the centre so where ever you plan to go while in Dubai this location is central and good restaurants available around this Hotel. This is now referred as Fortune Plaza and is accessible by Dubai Metro. This has some good clubs within for when you decide to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy !!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaz230
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was close to the airport and it was somewhere to shower and change before our flight. Well it was close to the airport but ..... the room smelt , the toilet was filthy the carpet was threadbare and covered in stains and when I opened the bedside cabinet there was a durex in it ....unused thankfully. We spent all day out of the room and didnt showe as even the towels were dirty. Only redeeming feature was that we didnt actually have to sleep in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: 400m23r
Reviews.Content: The upsides: Price about $70 per room per night, breakfast cheapish, wifi access cheapish, very cheap Bar. Near to the new Metro stop. Staff generally friendly. The downsides: Bathroom needs renovation, windows need cleaning, pool area needs renovation, bar dingy.

Reviews.Title: “not soo bad”
Reviews.Author: nere89
Reviews.Content: i was on transit,so at the airport they booked me in at princess hotel,i liked the way the staff handle guests,yes they got music at night,but i can swear i was never bothered by the noise,they even woke me up on time to go to the airport,i have been in hotel industry for sometime and i must confess that you are treated according to the way you portray yourself,so if you are friendly to the staff they will be friendly to you,if you boss them around then.........anyway i myself had the time of my life and they gave me a very clean room and even came for my luggage took it to the bus as i was leaving,i had to tip them off for making my stay very comfortable,theres a very short man[ magician]in the hotel,he really made my night,nice food too

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: muc123
Reviews.Content: That is the most bad hotel I have seen in the world. I had to stay here for one week, The air con is working very bad, you have ultra loud music until 02:00 a.m, if you have to work it is a pain in the a... The managemnt is shouting at you if you mentioning that, the bathroom been very dirty, safe in the room and the dvd remote controll is not working because no one is checking it. If you are lucky you will a room which is vacum cleaned with clean glases. If you are more than lucky they refill the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ads102
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here on business for 10 days and left feeling tired and run down. We were greeted by a dark reception with the smell of stale cigarettes, the same smell was throughout the hotel. The rooms were ok, bedding was clean and the bed was comfortable. The safe didn't have any batteries so didn't work. There is limited cable TV that includes a couple of free movie channels. The bathroom was small and dark, there is mould around the bath, and the bath had spots of rust where the enamel had been chipped off. There was something splattered on the bathroom floor, but I had no inclination to investigate further. The tablecloths at breakfast were dirty. The breakfast was not really to european tastes. I asked three times for an iron before I got one, then twice for an ironing board before giving up. There was a general noise within the room, i think from the external air conditioning units, and there are also several nightclubs in the hotel, so there is loud music throughout the hotel until 3am. I moved to a higher floor, but this made no difference. They are currently constructing a metro system right outside, so work starts on construction at 6am. The windows in the hotel (which are filthy) don't close completely, there is a gap of about 5-10mm around the window, so you can hear traffic noise from the busy 3 lane carrigeway outside. There is no wireless internet in the hotel, there is a computer in reception with internet access but this was broken for the duration of my stay. There is wifi at a cafe across the road. The hotel is in an area called Al Quasais which is a long way from any of the tourist areas. It's not possible to walk to the beach as there are not many walkways for pedestrians along the busy roads. Taxi's can be difficult to get at peak times as there is generally a lot of traffic congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel!! Should Be 1 Star Rating! No Not Stay Here Ever”
Reviews.Author: MOX286
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel by Royal Brunei airlines as our flight was cancelled. We barely survived the 24 hours and noone from our flight slept there as the beds were filthy. This hotel doesnt even look like in the photos and most certainly is not 3star by any standards. the carpets in the room were muddy the bathrom ahd hair on the floor and mould throught the shower and bath. Furtehrmore we couldnt even order room service as they knew we were from the flight so they didnt want to provide us with any service. They did not evn give us a bottle of water we got warm water at lunch and dinner where we were seperated from all paying guests into a small dining room where they cooked us a seperate meal. absolutely disgusting!!! we were not informed by the hotel when our flight would be leaving even thought they knew. We had to make an international call to our own travel agent. Dont even stay here if its free!! ure treated like a second class citizen and ud be better off sleping in the airport. Every person from our flight who stayed there agree with my opinion and all lodged complaints with the airline. hope this helps so noone elses holiday gets ruined by this disgusting hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware: overpriced and service below minimums”
Reviews.Author: friend2fly
Reviews.Content: Due to airline connections problems to KSA, I had to overnight a couple of days here with my family (wife and kid). We were received at the lobby by a strong smell of cigarrette; the room asigned (219) had a bathroom with a lot of fungus stuck to the bathtub and tiles; three noisy clubs inside the hotel assure that you can not sleep before three oçlock in the morning; we asked room service for our breakfast but it never came... There is no internet available!! (there is one across the street in case you need it). Apart of all, it is expensive. In brief if you need a bed for a one-night emergency situation and you can not get it in any other hotel, ok, take it. Otherwise, spend a few minutes more looking for a real hotel!! This hotel is the best example of what a hotel must not be!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its three star rating”
Reviews.Author: Frysch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the last week of October in 2007, having booked through Marhabah at the airport. We were collected from the airport by the hotel shuttle and found the driver as courteous as we would later find the hotel staff and management to be. We enjoyed breakfast in bed every day after which the front desk would call a taxi for us to go and explore the city. At th end of our stay we were taken back to the airport in the hotel shuttle. An excellent place if you.re not looking for extreme kuxury.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Dreams
Reviews.Content: First impressions were very good building outside looks very nice. I was very disappointed with the level of service from the staff. I went to my room and the safe was faulty had no batteries. The rooms were dull and cheap quality but they were tidy and warm, The shower and light switch was faulty and found them...I was not able to go the any nightclubs without not ordering anything, was very upset. This Hotel was very queit and no atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Twm99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Hotel for one night. The room was very clean and first impressions were good. However, as soon as I went to bed, live music started in the hotel nightclub. I could hear the music very clearly and phoned reception to find out (a) what time the music would stop (was told 0300) and (b) could they move me to a higher floor. They moved me to another floor, but I could still hear the music. I went down to reception and said I had a 10 hour flight the next day and had to get up at 0430 the next morning. I was told that the music would not stop before 0300 and there was nothing they could do. I even spoke to the Manager who said the same, and they could do nothing for me. What was even worse, was that there was no "sorry" and nothing near an apology was given to me. Basically, they couldn't care less. The nightclub had 3 people in it, but they had a hotel full of people trying to sleep. In addition they forgot my wakeup call for 0430! When I checked out I expected an apology which would have gone a long way, but again nothing was forthcoming. In summary, if you want to sleep, then don't stay here. In addition the managment couldn't care less about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BarbiePortHarcourt
Reviews.Content: I visited dubai for the first time this summer and wasn't disappointed. In fact I was over impressed. I stayed at the Princess Hotel. The staff were nice and warm and my room was always clean when I got back from shopping. I was impressed with my room because it was much better than what I had seen on the net. The staff were always helpful. The only problem was that the hotel was quite a distance from other sights and so I spent a lot on taxis. Altogether, I enjoyed my trip to Dubai and my stay and at th Princess Hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Princess Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Nahdha Rd | nr Airport Terminal 2, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
